issue.title: Crashes when saving config due to concurrent access
issue.body:
We have had intermitting failures of the CI on `test_api_watched_now`.
Turns out the problem is that `CFG_DATABASE` changes size (see traceback below).

I always found the whole setup of the `config.py` very very ugly with all it's `global`'s, just never got around to making a good class-based refactor.
If we do a refactor we can introduce proper locks around this.

For now marking it as `xfail`.

```
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3862707Z Traceback (most recent call last):
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3863442Z   File "c:\users\runneradmin\.virtualenvs\.venv\lib\site-packages\cherrypy\_cprequest.py", line 638, in respond
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3863941Z     self._do_respond(path_info)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3864605Z   File "c:\users\runneradmin\.virtualenvs\.venv\lib\site-packages\cherrypy\_cprequest.py", line 697, in _do_respond
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3865110Z     response.body = self.handler()
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3865782Z   File "c:\users\runneradmin\.virtualenvs\.venv\lib\site-packages\cherrypy\lib\encoding.py", line 223, in __call__
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3866308Z     self.body = self.oldhandler(*args, **kwargs)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3866996Z   File "c:\users\runneradmin\.virtualenvs\.venv\lib\site-packages\cherrypy\_cpdispatch.py", line 54, in __call__
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3867516Z     return self.callable(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3868015Z   File "D:\a\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\interface.py", line 191, in internal_wrap
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3868441Z     return wrap_func(*args, **kwargs)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3868872Z   File "D:\a\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\interface.py", line 467, in api
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3869323Z     return api_handler(kwargs)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3869750Z   File "D:\a\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\api.py", line 105, in api_handler
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3870219Z     response = _api_table.get(mode, (_api_undefined, 2))[0](name, kwargs)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3870722Z   File "D:\a\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\api.py", line 131, in _api_set_config
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3871100Z     config.save_config()
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3871513Z   File "D:\a\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\decorators.py", line 39, in call_func
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3871910Z     return func(*args, **kw)
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3872339Z   File "D:\a\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\sabnzbd\config.py", line 962, in save_config
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3872741Z     for section in CFG_DATABASE:
2023-09-17T19:08:35.3873112Z RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration
```

comment.body: We still should do a `class` based refactor..

commits.message:
Lock all config dict operations

Closes #2685

issue.title: Pausing URL grabber regression
issue.body:
### SABnzbd version

4.1.0

### Operating system

Linux

### Using Docker image

linuxserver

### Description

Hi,

I'm a new user to SABnzbd and am trying to use something that was mentioned in [an old issue](https://github.com/sabnzbd/sabnzbd/issues/988). This feature supposedly pauses the URL grabber under certain conditions, but unsuccessfully so far. I asked on Discord and was advised to create an issue.

I was under the impression that maybe having both SABnzbd paused and a RSS defaulting downloads to paused would simply create an entry in the queue without actually downloading the nzb file, but it looks like it does. I have a succession of those lines in the log:
```
[rss:474] Starting scheduled RSS read-out...
[rss:656] Adding https://...
[urlgrabber:400] Fetching https://...
[urlgrabber:120] Grabbing URL https://
```
Indicating that it is indeed fetching the file, but it is confirmed by the indexer anyway.

Am I misunderstanding the original issue? (in which case this would become a feature request)
Was there a regression at some point in history?

Thanks.

comment.body: So is there a workaround that I could use to make it happen? A pre-queue script maybe?

payload.description: SABnzbd - The automated Usenet download tool

issue.title: Pausing URL grabber regression
issue.body:
### SABnzbd version

4.1.0

### Operating system

Linux

### Using Docker image

linuxserver

### Description

Hi,

I'm a new user to SABnzbd and am trying to use something that was mentioned in [an old issue](https://github.com/sabnzbd/sabnzbd/issues/988). This feature supposedly pauses the URL grabber under certain conditions, but unsuccessfully so far. I asked on Discord and was advised to create an issue.

I was under the impression that maybe having both SABnzbd paused and a RSS defaulting downloads to paused would simply create an entry in the queue without actually downloading the nzb file, but it looks like it does. I have a succession of those lines in the log:
```
[rss:474] Starting scheduled RSS read-out...
[rss:656] Adding https://...
[urlgrabber:400] Fetching https://...
[urlgrabber:120] Grabbing URL https://
```
Indicating that it is indeed fetching the file, but it is confirmed by the indexer anyway.

Am I misunderstanding the original issue? (in which case this would become a feature request)
Was there a regression at some point in history?

Thanks.

comment.body: I don't think I want to fix this, because adding jobs (not the fetch) as paused is the more expected behaviour.

comment.body: Kind of, since RSS is a bit unpredictable, sometimes filters are not that effective, and I've found myself grabbing way too many entries on some occasions and got reprimanded for that as it was way beyond an acceptable use limit.

issue.title: Pausing URL grabber regression
issue.body:
### SABnzbd version

4.1.0

### Operating system

Linux

### Using Docker image

linuxserver

### Description

Hi,

I'm a new user to SABnzbd and am trying to use something that was mentioned in [an old issue](https://github.com/sabnzbd/sabnzbd/issues/988). This feature supposedly pauses the URL grabber under certain conditions, but unsuccessfully so far. I asked on Discord and was advised to create an issue.

I was under the impression that maybe having both SABnzbd paused and a RSS defaulting downloads to paused would simply create an entry in the queue without actually downloading the nzb file, but it looks like it does. I have a succession of those lines in the log:
```
[rss:474] Starting scheduled RSS read-out...
[rss:656] Adding https://...
[urlgrabber:400] Fetching https://...
[urlgrabber:120] Grabbing URL https://
```
Indicating that it is indeed fetching the file, but it is confirmed by the indexer anyway.

Am I misunderstanding the original issue? (in which case this would become a feature request)
Was there a regression at some point in history?

Thanks.

comment.body: My own use case is that I can decently filter RSS entries with advanced regexes, but it's never flawless (and probably won't ever be), and I want to evaluate manually whether I actually want to download or not after that 1st pass of filters. If paused jobs coming from RSS are not grabbed until unpaused, that would work for me as well, I don't need a global pause, I just thought it was the way it would work.

I was under the impression that maybe having both SABnzbd paused and a RSS defaulting downloads to paused would simply create an entry in the queue without actually downloading the nzb file, but it looks like it does. I have a succession of those lines in the log:
```
[rss:474] Starting scheduled RSS read-out...
[rss:656] Adding https://...
[urlgrabber:400] Fetching https://...
[urlgrabber:120] Grabbing URL https://
```
Indicating that it is indeed fetching the file, but it is confirmed by the indexer anyway.

Am I misunderstanding the original issue? (in which case this would become a feature request)
Was there a regression at some point in history?

Thanks.

comment.body:
People want that, to decided themselves when or if they want to download a job at all.
That's why we also have it in the Categories settings and it can be set from pre-queue script.

issue.title: [BUG] Temporary Download Folder creates subdirectory
issue.body:
### SABnzbd version

4.0.3

### Operating system

Windows (Docker)

### Using Docker image

linuxserver

### Description

### Current Behavior

Selecting a directory except `/incomplete-downloads` creates a subdirectory called `incomplete`, so basically choosing `downloads/incomplete` creates `downloads/incomplete/incomplete`.

Choosing just `downloads` is not allowed because `The Completed Download Folder cannot be the same or a subfolder of the Temporary Download Folder`.

**Example 1**
- `/downloads/complete` -> Completed downloads
- `/downloads/incomplete` -> Incompleted downloads

The latter will be `/downloads/incomplete/incomplete` even though they are already two distinct directories.

**Example 2**
- `/downloads/complete` -> Completed downloads
- `/incomplete-downloads` -> Incompleted downloads

The latter does not create a subdirectory.

**Example 3**
- `/downloads/complete` -> Completed downloads
- `/downloads` -> Incompleted downloads

The latter won't work even though it would automatically create a subdirectory called `incomplete` making it `/downloads/incomplete` and again two distinct directories.

This means that somewhere in the codebase a path/string match is done for `/incomplete-downloads` and if the path does not match a subdirectory is created, though not checking if the path base dir is the same as as `Completed Download Folder` and creating a subdirectory then.

### Expected Behavior

The application checks the path, compares it to the base path of `Completed Download Folder` and only throws the error if both paths truly are the same.

If `Temporary Download Folder`
- is `/incomplete-downloads` => do nothing
- is a sibling of `Completed Download Folder` => do nothing
- is the parent of `Completed Download Folder` => create directory `incomplete` and update path
- is the same as `Completed Download Folder` => throws the error

I hope this gets my point across.

This was the behaviour when switching from the official `sabnzbd/sabnzbd` image which I've used before, but ran on version 3.2.1 and is not available anymore unfortunately.

commits.message:
Refactor handling of Complete vs Incomplete check

Closes #2717
Refactor of some parts of Config saving

Refactor handling of Complete vs Incomplete check

Closes #2717
Refactor of some parts of Config saving

payload.description: SABnzbd - The automated Usenet download tool
